_hint_overview: This file defines template calendar plans for bulk creation in plans-service. Use the 'plans' array below to store real plans.

_hint_ids_vs_data.no_db_ids: Do NOT put DB ids for plans, mesocycles, microcycles, workouts, exercises or sets. They are generated by the service.
_hint_ids_vs_data.applied_layer: AppliedCalendarPlan*, user_max_ids and generated workouts belong to the apply layer and are NOT part of this file.

_hint_structure.microcycle: MicrocycleCreate: name, days_count, optional normalization (global value + normalization_rules[] for specific exercise_definition_ids), plan_workouts[]
_hint_structure.plan_workout: PlanWorkoutCreate: exercises[]; day_label is auto-generated from days_count if omitted
_hint_structure.set: ParamsSets: intensity(0-110), effort(1-10), volume(reps); working_weight is for instances, not for plans

plan_macro_notes.hint: Эти заметки описывают методологическую динамику планов (делоды, AMRAP-прогрессия и т.п.) и ожидаемый формат rule_json для PlanMacro. Они НЕ часть схемы CalendarPlanCreate и будут проигнорированы plans-service при создании плана.

trigger.metric: Total_Reps | Reps_Delta_From_Plan | RPE_Session | RPE_Delta_From_Plan | e1RM | Performance_Trend | Readiness_Score
trigger.exercise_id(s): optional, restrict metrics to specific lifts

condition.op: simple: >, <, >=, <=, =, in_range | history: holds_for, stagnates_for, deviates_from_avg

Starting Strength: Complete Novice Linea.summary: Авто-прогрессия малыми шагами, делоды после нескольких срывов. В статике заданы только инкременты через normalization_rules.
macros_expected: Per-lift делод (~10%) после 3 воркаутов подряд, где Reps_Delta_From_Plan < 0 (отдельно для Squat, Bench/Press, Deadlift)
Опционально: заморозка инкрементов, если Reps_Delta_From_Pлан колеблется около нуля несколько сессий

StrongLifts 5x5.summary: Добавление веса только если все 5x5 выполнены; при срыве — повторение веса, при нескольких срывах — делод. В статическом плане заложен только номинальный прирост по неделям.
macros_expected: Deload (~10%) по каждому базовому упражнению, если Reps_Delta_From_Plan < 0 держится N сессий (например, 3)
Регулировка объёма (Adjust_Sets) на Squat при высоком RPE_Session (например, снижение с 5x5 до 3x5)

GZCLP: The Linear Progression.summary: Прогрессия T1/T2 по тренду производительности (e1RM/объём), T3 — авторегуляция по RPE и объёму. План задаёт только базовые проценты и RPE, решения о повышении/снижении нагрузки принимаются по фактическим данным.
macros_expected: Adjust_Load(by_Percent) для T1/T2 при положительном Performance_Trend по ключевым лифтам
Adjust_Sets(by_Value) для T3-упражнений (Lat Pulldown/Row) при устойчиво высоком RPE_Delta_From_Plan

Greyskull LP (Phrak's Variant) - Percent.summary: Основной драйвер — AMRAP-сеты: при высоком результате AMRAP увеличиваем вес, при низком — удерживаем или делодуем. В плане зашит только факт AMRAP (effort=10) и % нагрузки.
macros_expected: Увеличение нагрузки по жимам/приседу/подтягиваниям, если Total_Reps по рабочим сетам (включая AMRAP) достигает верхней границы диапазона
Deload (например, -5..-10%) при систематически низком Total_Reps по AMRAP-сетам несколько сессий подряд

plans.name: Starting Strength: Complete Novice Linear Progression

_macro_notes.summary: Starting Strength NLP использует авто-прогрессию с малыми шагами и делоды после нескольких срывов. В статичном плане зашиты только базовые инкременты через normalization_rules; детектирование срывов и автоматические делоды должны реализовываться макросами.

suggested_macros.name: SS Squat deload after 3 failed workouts
SS Bench/Press deload after 3 failed workouts
SS Deadlift deload after 3 failed workouts

_macro_notes.summary: StrongLifts 5x5 методологически использует правило: если все 5x5 выполнены, в следующий раз +инкремент; при срывах вес повторяется, после нескольких срывов — делод (~10%). В плане зашиты агрессивные normalization_rules (инкременты по неделям), но логика "не добавлять вес при срыве" и автоматические делоды должны быть реализованы макросами.

suggested_macros.name: SL Deload after 3 failed workouts per lift
SL Reduce to 3x5 on chronic high fatigue (Squat)

_macro_notes.summary: GZCLP опирается на AMRAP/объём как драйвер прогрессии (T1/T2/T3), а не только на фиксированные проценты. В плане зашиты базовые проценты и T3 с auto-интенсивностью через RPE, но принятие решения "повысить/снизить вес/объём" по факту выполненных повторений/RPE должно делаться макросами.

suggested_macros.name: GZCLP T1/T2 progression on e1RM trend
GZCLP T3 autoreg: cut sets when RPE consistently above plan

_macro_notes.summary: Greyskull LP (Phrak) методологически держится на AMRAP-сетах: если AMRAP достигает/превышает целевой диапазон повторений, прибавляем вес; при плохих сессиях — удерживаем или делодуем. В плане зашиты проценты и AMRAP через effort=10, но зависимость инкремента от результата AMRAP должна быть реализована макросами.

suggested_macros.name: GSLP Increase load when total reps high (press/bench/squat/chins)
GSLP Deload when AMRAP underperforms for several workouts

_macro_notes.summary: nSuns-style 5-day linear progression with a weekly loop and 95% AMRAP top sets for main lifts. Static plan encodes warm-up/back-off work; dynamic load adjustments are handled by macros based on AMRAP performance or session RPE.
progression_logic: FOR EACH lift IN {Squat(35), Deadlift(29), Bench(15), OHP(19)}:
FIND 95% top set (intensity=95, effort=10).
Let completed_reps = actual reps done.
IF completed_reps <= 1 THEN next increment = 0 kg.
IF 2 <= completed_reps <= 3 THEN next increment = +2.5 kg.
IF 4 <= completed_reps <= 5 THEN next increment = +5.0 kg.
IF completed_reps > 5 THEN next increment = +7.5 kg.

suggested_macros.name: nSuns: Auto-progression on good sessions
nSuns: Deload on chronically hard sessions

_macro_notes.summary: Classic Texas Method with Volume/Recovery/Intensity structure, arranged as alternating Week A (bench focus) and Week B (OHP focus). Static plan encodes 5x5 volume, light recovery, and 1x5 intensity. Engine-driven macros are expected to adjust load based on fatigue and inject deload behavior if needed.

suggested_macros.name: Texas Method: auto-increase load on consistently easy sessions
Texas Method: deload on high fatigue

_macro_notes.summary: Madcow 5x5 linear progression driven strictly by 1RM-derived 5RM. Monday uses ramped 5x5 volume, Wednesday light work, Friday heavy triples with backoff. Engine should carry over Friday’s top triple load into next Monday’s top set and apply normalization rules for the next Friday target.
progression_logic: Let Friday set5 (90% triple) actual load be W.
Next Monday set5 (87.5% 5RM) target load is W (rounded to nearest load increment).
Apply normalization_rules per lift to compute new Friday 90% triple target for the following week.
Optional macros can implement deload or partial resets after repeated failures to hit Friday’s triple.

_macro_notes.summary: 5/3/1 Boring But Big cycle scaled to true 1RM via Training Max (TM). Main work uses 3x5, 3x3, and 5/3/1 waves with AMRAP top sets, followed by high-volume BBB assistance at ~50% TM. Deload week optionally increases TM for the next cycle via normalization rules.
progression_logic: Each 4-week cycle uses a fixed TM per lift (e.g., 85-90% of true 1RM).
Week 1: 65/75/85% TM with 5+ AMRAP on the top set.
Week 2: 70/80/90% TM with 3+ AMRAP on the top set.
Week 3: 75/85/95% TM with 1+ AMRAP on the top set.
Week 4: Deload at 40/50/60% TM.
After deload, TM can be increased by normalization_rules (e.g., +2.5 kg for upper body, +5 kg for lower body).

suggested_macros.name: 5/3/1: Increase TM after successful cycle
5/3/1: Deload or freeze TM on high fatigue

_macro_notes.summary: 5/3/1 Classic (Triumvirate) with standard 4-week 5/3/1 waves and two assistance movements per day. Training Max (TM) is a fixed fraction of true 1RM; AMRAP top sets drive progression while assistance is autoregulated by RPE.
progression_logic: Each 4-week block uses a fixed TM per lift.
Week 1: 65/75/85% TM with 5+ AMRAP on the top set.
Week 2: 70/80/90% TM with 3+ AMRAP on the top set.
Week 3: 75/85/95% TM with 1+ AMRAP on the top set.
Week 4: Deload at 40/50/60% TM.
After deload, TM can be increased via normalization_rules (lower body +5 kg, upper body +2.5 kg).

suggested_macros.name: 5/3/1 Classic: Increase TM after strong block
5/3/1 Classic: Deload or freeze TM on high fatigue

_macro_notes.summary: 5/3/1 Building the Monolith: 3-week high-volume 5/3/1 block built around heavy 5x5 squats, bench, deadlift and overhead press, plus large total reps of chins, dips, rows, curls and shrugs. All main work is scaled to a Training Max (TM) derived from true 1RM.
progression_logic: Single 3-week block built on 5/3/1 percentages and very high volume.
Week 1: High volume at ~70–90% TM with 5x5 work and widowmaker squats.
Week 2: Slightly lower peak intensity but sustained 5x5 main work.
Week 3: Peak volume and intensity, with 5x5 work near 95% TM and heavy widowmakers.
After Week 3, normalization_rules increase TM (lower body +5 kg, upper body +2.5 kg), and the lifter may repeat the block with updated loads.

suggested_macros.name: Monolith: Increase TM after strong block
Monolith: Reduce TM on excessive fatigue

_macro_notes.summary: Juggernaut Method 2.0: 16-week TM-based cycle for Squat, Bench, Deadlift, and Overhead Press, organized in four waves (10s, 8s, 5s, 3s). Each wave uses Accumulation, Intensification, Realization, and Deload weeks. TM (Training Max) is updated after realization AMRAPs.
progression_logic: Wave 10s: High-volume sets of 10 at roughly 60–70% TM for Accumulation and Intensification, then a realization AMRAP set around 75% TM. TM is updated using a function of (reps - 10).
Wave 8s: Similar structure with sets of 8 and an AMRAP around 80% TM; TM is updated from the 8-rep realization test (reps - 8).
Wave 5s: Heavier 5-rep work with an AMRAP around 85% TM; TM is updated from the 5-rep test (reps - 5).
Wave 3s: Peaking triples around 90% TM with a final AMRAP; TM is updated from the 3-rep test (reps - 3), after which the lifter typically restarts at the 10s wave or switches program.

_macro_notes.summary: PHAT combines two heavy power days (upper/lower) with three higher-volume hypertrophy days (back/shoulders, lower, chest/arms). Power work progresses linearly via normalization rules, while hypertrophy work follows a double progression model.
progression_logic: Power days (Upper/Lower Power): 3x5 at ~80% 1RM on key lifts with weekly load increases via normalization_rules.
Hypertrophy days: speed work at ~65% 1RM on the main lift followed by higher-rep assistance sets at RPE 8–9.
Double progression: when a hypertrophy assistance movement hits the top of its rep range at target RPE for multiple sessions, the lifter increases load manually next week.

_macro_notes.summary: Westside Barbell Conjugate: 4-дневный сплит с Max Effort и Dynamic Effort для верха и низа, организованный в 3-недельные DE-волны и еженедельную ротацию вариаций основных упражнений.
progression_logic: Max Effort (ME) дни: один главный лифт для низа и верха, каждую неделю используется новая вариация (Good Morning, Box Squat, Deadlift для низа; Floor/Board/Incline Bench для верха). К той же вариации не возвращаются минимум 4–6 недель. На каждой ME-сессии атлет разминается по процентам и выходит на дневной максимум (одиночка RPE 10).

Dynamic Effort (DE) дни: скоростная работа с субмаксимальными весами. В этом шаблоне реализована 3-недельная волна: неделя 1 @ ~50% 1RM, неделя 2 @ ~55%, неделя 3 @ ~60% для приседаний/становой (8–12 подходов по 2 или 1 повторению) и жима (9×3). После 3-й недели волна может быть перезапущена с новыми вариациями или конфигурацией бэндов/цепей.

Repeated Effort (RE) аксессуары (задняя цепь, трицепсы, верх спины, пресс) выполняются в диапазоне 8–25 повторений при RPE 8–10. Вес подбирается и прогрессируется вручную так, чтобы оставаться в целевом диапазоне повторений и утомления.

_macro_notes.summary: Three-phase Sheiko-style powerlifting cycle: #29 Intro (medium volume at ~50–75%); #37 Volume Accumulation with double sessions and very high volume; #32 Peaking and Competition with taper, heavy singles and meet. Static 1RM normalization is applied after the meet via normalization_rules; dynamic fatigue management and progression are expected to be implemented via macros.

suggested_macros.name: Sheiko fatigue-based deload for competition lifts
Sheiko post-meet load bump on positive performance trend

_macro_notes.summary: 12-week Sheiko-style macrocycle for beginner-intermediate lifters: #29 Intro (medium volume) -> #30 Loading (high volume and intensity) -> #31 Realization (peaking + mock meet/test). Static normalization after the test week updates training maxes; optional macros can be used to conditionally deload or adjust future loads based on test performance.

suggested_macros.name: Beginner Sheiko: post-test normalization only on successful mock meet

_macro_notes.summary: Single 4-week high volume shock mesocycle modeled on Sheiko #27: double-split grind with very high volume in competition squat, bench and deadlift. No in-cycle normalization; recommended only after at least one prior Sheiko-style block.
4-week intensity transition mesocycle modeled on Sheiko #28: moderate volume, higher average intensities (~80%) for comp squat, bench and deadlift.
_macro_notes.instruction: Run for 4 weeks. Focus on quality reps with ~80% load and maintain technique under fatigue.

_macro_notes.summary: 4-week squat specialization block modeled on Sheiko #33: low-to-moderate intensity, high technical focus with pause squats, front squats and high-rep back squats.
_macro_notes.instruction: Use this block to fix squat form. Emphasize depth, bar path and control; keep deadlift volume minimal or maintained in other cycles.

_macro_notes.summary: 4-week high-frequency bench specialization block modeled on Sheiko #34: 4 bench-focused sessions per week (heavy, variation, volume, accessories). Squat and deadlift are kept at maintenance on non-bench days.
_macro_notes.instruction: Bench frequency is 4x/week. Squat/Deadlift should be done on Day 2 or Day 4 at maintenance levels (not encoded in this plan). Keep technique crisp and avoid grinding on most sets.

_macro_notes.summary: 4-week deadlift emphasis block modeled on Sheiko #35: double pull session with halting deadlifts, rack pulls and deficit pulls; squat and bench kept mostly at maintenance.
_macro_notes.instruction: Heavy emphasis on posterior chain. Watch out for lower back fatigue; autoregulate accessories when needed.

_macro_notes.summary: 4-week low-stress transition block modeled on Sheiko #36: reduced intensity and moderate volume for all three competition lifts plus light accessories.
_macro_notes.instruction: Relaxed intensity. Do not push weights. Use this block between heavy Sheiko cycles or after meet prep.

_macro_notes.summary: 1-week competition taper block (2 weeks out) modeled on Sheiko #38: low volume, heavy singles at 90% for all three competition lifts.
_macro_notes.instruction: Penultimate week. 90% singles with submaximal RPE; prioritize bar speed and technique. Next week is competition.

_macro_notes.summary: 1-week higher-volume taper block modeled on Sheiko #39: keeps more volume at 70–85% closer to the meet, good for heavier lifters.
_macro_notes.instruction: Keeps volume higher closer to the meet than #38. Good for heavyweights; monitor fatigue and cut sets if bar speed drops.

_macro_notes.summary: 2-week standard peaking block modeled on Sheiko #40: taper week followed by competition week with meet attempts.
_macro_notes.instruction: Week 3 is a light taper/deload with 50-75% loads; Week 4 is competition week. Rest completely 2-3 days before meet and visualize lifts.
Rest completely 2-3 days before meet. Visualize lifts.

_macro_notes.summary: 2-week higher-volume taper block modeled on Sheiko #41: maintains more work at 75-80% plus meet week.
_macro_notes.instruction: Maintains more sets at 75-80% to keep CNS primed. Good for athletes > 100kg; cut volume if fatigue accumulates.
Maintains more sets at 75-80% to keep CNS primed. Good for athletes > 100kg.

_macro_notes.summary: 2-week RAW peaking block modeled on Sheiko #42: RAW-specific taper week plus competition week.
_macro_notes.instruction: Specifically designed for RAW lifters: manage joint stress, arrive fresh at the meet, and avoid heavy equipped overloads.
Specifically designed for RAW lifters. Ensures full joint recovery before the meet.

_macro_notes.summary: Extreme volume accumulation cycle for MS/MSIC-level lifters (Sheiko #43). The hardest preparatory block.
_macro_notes.instruction: Typically run for ~4 weeks before moving to #44 or a deload. Average intensity is low (~68-70%), but number of lifts is huge; use only with elite, well-prepared lifters.
Typically run for 4 weeks before moving to #44 or a deload. Average intensity is low (~68-70%), but number of lifts is huge.

_macro_notes.summary: High-intensity transmutation block for elite lifters (Sheiko #44) with multiple heavy sets at 85-90%.
_macro_notes.instruction: Includes multiple sets at 90%. If successfully completed, transition into a taper such as #40 or a similar peaking block.
Includes multiple sets at 90%. If successfully completed, proceed to a taper block such as #40 or #46.

_macro_notes.summary: Elite technical block focused on paused, deficit, box and board variations (Sheiko #45).
_macro_notes.instruction: Requires specialized equipment (boards, boxes, chains). If unavailable, substitute with tempo and pause variations while keeping volumes and intensities similar.
Requires specialized equipment (boards, boxes, chains). If unavailable, substitute with tempo/pause variations.

_macro_notes.summary: Heavy realization week for elite lifters (Sheiko #46): 90–95% singles on competition lifts to test readiness before taper.
_macro_notes.instruction: Pred-sorevnovatel'nyi tyazhelyi mikrotsikl: 90–95% singly po pravilam IPF, fokus na tekhnike i skorosti, zatem perekhod k taperu (naprimer, #40 ili #48).
Last heavy week before taper. Ensure perfect technique and command on all 90–95% singles.

_macro_notes.summary: RAW volume accumulation cycle optimized for 70–75% loading (Sheiko #47).
_macro_notes.instruction: Notice fewer sets at 80% compared to classic Sheiko high-volume blocks; most work is 70–75% to protect joints in RAW lifting while still building work capacity.
Notice fewer sets at 80% compared to #37/#43, but more volume at 70-75% to protect joints in RAW lifting.

_macro_notes.summary: Meet-week taper block (Sheiko #48) with very light work and competition attempts.
_macro_notes.instruction: Keep everything submaximal until the meet, focus on speed and technical rehearsal; then perform planned attempts on competition day.

_macro_notes.status: Cycle Complete. Take 1 week active rest after competition.

_macro_notes.summary: Experimental ultra-volume cycle (Sheiko #50) intended only for elite, pharmacologically supported lifters.
_macro_notes.instruction: Экспериментальный цикл с экстремальным объёмом. Только для элиты под фармакологией; риск перетренированности максимален.
Experimental load. If fatigue is uncontrollable, switch to #37 immediately.

_macro_notes.summary: Deadlift-focused peak block with deficit and chain variations (Sheiko #51).
_macro_notes.instruction: Use this block to peak deadlift while keeping squat and bench at maintenance volume. Monitor low-back fatigue carefully.

_macro_notes.summary: 4-day high-frequency bench specialization block (Sheiko #52).
_macro_notes.instruction: Bench-focused cycle with 4 sessions per week; squat and deadlift are kept at maintenance volume. Monitor elbows and shoulders for overuse.

_macro_notes.summary: RTS-style generalized intermediate template with autoregulated top sets and fatigue work for squat, bench, and deadlift.
_macro_notes.methodology: Reactive Training Systems (RTS) autoregulation using RPE-based top sets and load-drop fatigue sets.
_macro_notes.fatigue_protocol: For main lifts: work up to a Top Set @ RPE 9, then reduce load by ~5% and perform additional sets until RPE again reaches 9.
_macro_notes.normalization_logic: Do not force 1RM normalization via fixed kg jumps. Instead, treat the estimated 1RM from the top set (weight / coefficient) as the basis for warmups in subsequent microcycles.

_macro_notes.fatigue_protocol: For main lifts: work up to a Top Set @ RPE 9, then subtract ~5% from bar weight and perform additional sets until RPE again reaches 9.
_macro_notes.normalization_logic: Do NOT force normalization via fixed kg jumps. Use the E1RM from the Top Set (weight / coefficient) to guide warmup weights for the next microcycle.

_macro_notes.summary: The flagship Tactical Barbell Operator program for operational athletes. High frequency, low volume, and managed fatigue over six weeks.
_macro_notes.instruction: Use this as a base strength template alongside conditioning and job-specific work. Keep reps crisp and avoid grinding; typically leave 1-2 reps in reserve on most sets.
_macro_notes.intensity_structure: Block uses fixed percentage weeks (70/80/90/75/85/95%) with three weekly sessions built around squat, bench, deadlift, and weighted pull-ups.

_macro_notes.progression: After Week 6, force progression (add weight to training maxes for squat, bench, deadlift, and weighted pull-ups) and restart from Week 1.

_macro_notes.summary: Tactical Barbell: Fighter — минималистичная 2-дневная силовая программа для бойцов и атлетов выносливости.
_macro_notes.instruction: Две тяжёлые силовые сессии в неделю, остальное время посвящено спаррингам, бегу и специфической подготовке. Подходы выполняются с запасом 1–2 повтора, без выхода в отказ.
_macro_notes.intensity_structure: 6-недельный блок с неделями 70/80/90/75/85/95% и финальным тестом на 6-й неделе.

_macro_notes.progression: After Week 6, force progression (add weight to training maxes for squat, bench, deadlift, and weighted pull-ups/rows) and restart from Week 1.

_macro_notes.summary: Интенсивный 3-недельный цикл Smolov Jr. с 4 тренировками в неделю.
_macro_notes.instruction: Подходит для приседа или жима. Выбери одно основное упражнение и придерживайся его весь цикл. Можно сделать отдельную копию плана с заменой exercise_definition_id 35→15 для жима.
_macro_notes.cycle_logic: Микроцикл повторяется 3 раза. Неделя 1: базовый вес. Неделя 2: базовый вес +5 кг. Неделя 3: базовый вес +7.5–10 кг.
Повтори этот недельный паттерн 3 раза, каждую неделю добавляя вес согласно описанию цикла.

_macro_notes.summary: Классический полный Smolov на 13 недель: вводный блок, базовый мезоцикл, переходный блок, интенсивный блок и тейпер.
_macro_notes.instruction: Очень тяжёлый цикл. Используй только при хорошем стаже, без других тяжёлых нижних тренировок. Следи за техникой и восстановлением.

_macro_notes.info: Run this structure for 2 weeks to prepare hips/knees. Lunges and jumps recommended as accessories.

_macro_notes.instruction: Repeat 3 times. Week 2: +10kg. Week 3: +15kg (from base).
Find new 1RM. Use this new max for the Intense Cycle.

_macro_notes.info: Box Squats and negative squats are treated as squat variants for speed and recovery work.

_macro_notes.instruction: Repeat for 4 weeks. Intensity stays high (85–95%), reps decrease (5→4→3) as weeks progress.
Meet Day. Attempt a new PR at ~105% of the new max.
Perform this loop twice (2 weeks). Focus on speed and recovery.

_macro_notes.summary: Высокочастотный болгарский стиль: ежедневный выход на тяжёлую единицу по приседу и жиму, тяга 2 раза в неделю.
_macro_notes.instruction: Подходит только для опытных атлетов с хорошим восстановлением. Дни почти идентичны: выход на дневной максимум и лёгкие откаты. Следи за болью в суставах и ЦНС.
_macro_notes.lifecycle: Микроцикл можно крутить бесконечно (The Grind). Разумно делать разгрузку или смену блока каждые 4–6 недель.

_macro_notes.logic: 1) Разминайся до тяжёлой единицы (RPE 9–10) в приседе и жиме каждый день. 2) На основе этого дневного максимума делай 1–2 откатных подхода (обычно −15–20% от дневного макса). 3) Если чувствуешь себя плохо — останавливайся на RPE 8, если хорошо — иди на рекорд.
_macro_notes.deadlift_usage: Становая: один день — тяжёлая, но не максимальная единица (до ~90%), второй — скоростные двойки ~75%.

_macro_notes.summary: 10-недельная специализация на жиме лёжа с поддерживающим объёмом по приседу и тяге.
_macro_notes.instruction: Основной прогресс идёт через День 1 (объём жима) и День 2 (вариации и трицепс). Присед и тяга — на уровне поддержки.
_macro_notes.progression: Week 1–10: линейный рост нагрузки. Объёмные сеты Дня 1 движутся от 5×5 @ 75% к 5×3 @ ~92%. День 2 остаётся аксессуарным, но веса также могут плавно расти.
Week 1–10 Linear Ramp. Day 1 volume sets прогрессируют от 5×5 @ ~75% к 5×3 @ ~90–92%. День 2 — вариации (pauses / Spoto) и объём по трицепсу, веса растут медленнее.

_macro_notes.summary: Low-volume, high-intensity Doggcrapp (DC) Training с rest-pause подходами и прогрессией через логбук.
_macro_notes.instruction: Каждое упражнение выполняется в формате rest-pause или тяжёлых straight sets. Цель — прогрессировать по весу или повторам на каждой сессии; при стагнации меняем упражнение.
_macro_notes.progression: Блок 'Blast' длится 6+ недель. При переутомлении делается Cruise/делоуд на 1–2 недели.

_macro_notes.progression_rule: BEAT THE LOGBOOK. Нужно добавлять вес или повторы на каждом упражнении в каждой ротации. Если не удаётся улучшить результат 2–3 раза подряд, меняй упражнение.
_macro_notes.frequency: Тренировки 3 раза в неделю (обычно Пн/Ср/Пт). Ротация: A1–B1–A2–B2–A3–B3 и затем повтор.

_macro_notes.summary: High-intensity bodybuilding-блок в стиле Mountain Dog с упором на памп, активацию и растяжку под нагрузкой.
_macro_notes.instruction: Сконцентрируйся на mind-muscle connection, контроле эксцентрики и добивании целевой мышцы, а не на абсолютных весах.
_macro_notes.focus: Mind-muscle connection и боль в мышцах (RPE 9–10/near failure для большинства сетов).
_macro_notes.progression: Добавляй объём (сеты) или интенсивность (дропсеты, кластер-сеты, частичные повторы) неделя за неделей.

_macro_notes.focus: Mind-muscle connection и болючий памп. Большинство сетов выполняются на RPE 9–10 с дропсетами, кластерами и частичными повторениями.
_macro_notes.progression: Увеличивай объём (сеты/повторы) или добавляй интенсивность (дропсеты, кластеры, паузы в растянутой позиции) по мере адаптации.
